pros:
Work from home culture
Good and kind mentors
cons: No career progression for Interns

pros: Loved my time there, staff was extremely nice and helpful and I learnt a lot while there.
cons: Unpaid internship, made it seem that I had a possibility to be hired on only to be told there wasn't room in the budget

review_title: Save yourself the time and apply elsewhere
pros: The best benefit for full time employees is a $10 co-pay for online therapy - which you will need if you take a job here. Work life balance is decent, not out of respect to employees, but due to lack of accountability.
cons: Classic toxic work environment. Communication from senior leadership flows downward in gossip-y circles even regarding critical issues like possible Covid-related layoffs. DEI conversations are treated as too risky to partake in, and all efforts from well-meaning staff to better the organization and the work are not taken seriously by senior leadership. As an employee I felt undervalued, and under-supported during an incredibly hard year. People of color beware - this will not be a healthy work environment for you.

pros: Great staff with a great work environment
cons: No stipend for transportation costs

pros: good management during the day
cons: nothing really bad to say so cool

pros: Great team, super inclusive and receptive to new ideas.
cons: Not applicable, really nice place

pros:
-Dedicated teams
-Great benefits and flexibility
-Inspiring work and stories from the field
-Decent job stability. There were layoffs a few years ago, but none since.
cons:
-Salaries for manager/director-levels and below aren't competitive
-Rotating door of leadership and ED. EDs have lasted only 1-2 years for the past 10 years. Currently looking for yet another ED. Lost three black female senior leaders in 2020.
-Challenges with internal culture that led to the creation of a "culture committee" and a Root Cause Analysis at the board level the following year. No real change ever came of either. All feels performative. Org leadership seems resistant to change.
-Staff told by HR not to discuss BLM at work, and the org otherwise remained very quiet on the subject.
-Crippling Founder's Syndrome
-Overall, the leadership from the very top feels antiquated and of touch.

reviewer_affiliation: Former Temporary Employee, less than 1 year
pros: Organization doing great work, especial in the field offices
cons: I was not there long enough to get to know my colleauges

review_title: Great Organization to work and lot to learn during the process.
pros: Opportunity to learn, Flexible working hours, Understanding
cons: Under Pressure, lot to handle

pros: Great mission. Good staff. Good benefits
cons: BIPOC need not apply. Suffering identity crisis. No direction from leadership. Difficult location to travel.

pros: Amazing coworkers, amazing mission, proximity to city is ideal, metro stop goes to Vienna from Metro DC
cons: I didn't have negative experiences working there

pros: Good benefits and salary packages for senior staff
cons: Poor salary package and benefits for field staff. Poor leadership

review_title: Feel good work, lacking project funding
pros: Inclusive, impactful, community-based (change starts at home attitude), encouraging, educational, welcoming
cons: Lack of funding, resulting in insufficient staff and resources for project completion.

review_title: An incredibly encouraging team that makes you feel invaluable
job_title: Roots & Shoots in San Francisco, CA
pros: This is an organization that does such good work globally and nationally that it makes you feel like you are making a difference for the world every day. I worked specifically with youth conservation because I worked for Roots& Shoots so we culled through youth conservation projects daily, reading about all of the good work children are doing around the world, it really gives you hope. My supervisors were SOOO encouraging about everything I did, they always gave constructive feedback and were always on their game. Even though we all worked remotely, we were all able to communicate very effectively.
cons: Sometimes it can be hard to work alone every day but that is about the only downside.

review_title: Overall, it was a positive and valuable work experience.
pros: My experience there involved wonderful supervisors and a real team atmosphere. I had opportunities to learn, grow and try new things. I felt valued, respected and listened to. The benefits package is better than any other I've experienced or heard about out.
cons: During a recent period of rapid growth, the organization seemed to be working to strike a balance between program staff and support staff. I'm not sure they've got the optimal proportions yet.

job_title: Associate In Research in Durham, NC
pros: If you are invited to the weekly lab meetings you get to hear about cutting edge research in the field. Occasionally flexible hours depending on the lab manager.
cons: Work study kids are disposable. Hours can be flexible but weekly quotas must be met. Unless certain quotas are met then kids are let go without fair warning to adjust their hours and meet unstated standards.

review_title: Chaotic, lack of vision, lack of support
job_title: Programs in Dar es Salaam, Dar es Salaam
pros: Working with Jane Goodall and staff
cons: The biggest problem is the toxic program management. The staff work as best as they can on a lot of things. But it’s very hierarchical with leadership lacking management skills.  There is a huge management problem. Mangers do not know how to be mangers. You have to be comfortable with managing up. Little to no authority is given to you yet you are blamed for the leadership’s lack of experience. Innovation is not encouraged, management is set in their outdated ways. Internal communication is stifled by a lack of structure and flexibility.

pros:
- enable 'think global, act local' concept to become a reality in Hong Kong
- provide a platform for public, especially families and youth to embrace and appreciate the beauty of nature
cons:
- small scale NGO with not enough manpower and funding source
- lack of a resourceful board of director to lead the NGO to create a larger impact locally and globally

review_title: Great Mission - Now Get a Great Strategic Plan
pros: Mission, Coworker Collaboration, Flexibility, Ability to Speak Your Opinion, Members of the org are great people to meet
cons: Lack of clarity on goals - often changing from year to year. Also need some consistant fundraisers.

pros: The staff there were very friendly! They took the time to get to know me and the office culture was extremely friendly.
cons: Staff doesn't always collaborate on things that effect projects involving the entire staff.

job_title: Staff Accountant in Tysons Corner, VA
pros: Pretty organized management. Very close knit team that worked well together. All around friendly environment
cons: When I was working there the GL software was a bit dated.

review_title: Great team with a great mission
pros: Great team with a great mission
cons: Office location is isolated from DC based activities and partners

job_title: Vice President Finance in Vienna, VA
pros: Dr. Jane Goodall living founder
cons: unstable funding, project based accounting needed
